sub_title: Public Policy | Green Mobility | Sustainable Living
summary:
We exist because of the world around us, so it's common sense to take proper care of that world. Which is why I focus on environmental policy making, advising policy makers on ways forward into making our societies fit within natural systems. 

I like to conjure up wildly imaginative ideas, involve others, and then make the resulting plans realistic and workable. 
With a solid basis in exact sciences, ample experience in campaigning and communications, and a solid capacity to advise on and negotiate in policy making, I'm able to translate between specialists, engineers, citizens, politicians, civil servants and elected members or parliament.

school.name: ITIP, school for work and life

projects.title: Agenda for shared mobility in rural areas
projects.description: How can shared mobility (e.g. car sharing, bike sharing, etc.) add to pubic transport systems in rural areas? Typically, sharing systems flourish in urban areas because of high densities and many users close by. In rural areas, where more space is available, people tend to own a private car and rely heavily on it for getting around. Because public transport (buses, trains) is further away, as well as supermarkets, doctors, schools, etc. So what's the public case for shared mobility in such areas? And what's the business case?

projects.title: Train2EU - the first European railway company
projects.description: Initiator of a young professionals idea to improve cross-border services for European train travellers. Currently responsible for setting up a project bureau, acquiring funds. Our aims for 2015 are to research the business potential for well-organised European rail services; to host a seminar for young professionals who work in European rail; to commit European politics to an ambitious agenda to improve European rail services.

projects.title: Coalition for improving European rail travel
projects.description:
Travelling in Europe is fantastic, but organising any border crossing train trip is still a hassle. With increasing pressure on the transport sector to reduce CO2-emissions, rail travel needs to become the most attractive, affordable and memorable travel option available. To start up innovative thinking in the institute of tradition that the rail sector is today, we muster the forces of the sector's generation of young professionals. 
I co-ordinate the project from Natuur & Milieu, who initiated the coalition.

projects.title: Public support for offshore wind farms
projects.description: Our dreams for a future with clean and affordable energy always contains images of large scale wind farms on the North Sea. In the 2013 National Energy Agreement, Dutch government, employers' and employees' associations and environmental NGOs committed to increasing the capacity of offshore wind energy generation tenfold in ten years. A dramatic ambition that we aim to achieve with the best added benefits possible for human economies, marine life and birds.

projects.title: SOSlucht / Air quality campaign during EU elections
projects.description:
As part of the European election campaign, Dutch green party GroenLinks organised a two-week campaign on air quality called SOSlucht ('SOSair'). The campaign focused on pointing out polluted spots in built-up areas to potential voters, explaining what the green party can do to improve air quality if re-elected into the European Parliament. 
My role was to supply scientifically based support for the campaign. This included co-authoring press-releases, and helping a team of volunteers to take measurements with a mobile particle counter.

projects.title: The Green Energy Union
projects.description:
As part of the European election campaign, I authored the Dutch action plan for a Green Energy Union for GroenLinks. The Green Energy Union plan is the first one to combine scenario studies with a political agenda. It sketches the necessary political decisions the European Union and its member states need to make, and the sets the required investment priorities. 

I was main author of the plan under the direction of MEP Bas Eickhout.

projects.title: Cleaner Car Contracts
projects.description:
With Cleaner Car Contracts, we raise the corporate lease sector's interest in fuel-efficient vehicles, and show the interest the sector has to political decision makers in Brussels.Five European NGOs aim to show just how much enthusiasm and ambition the lease sector has for fuel-efficient vehicles. 
I coordinated the project in the five participating countries and develop required materials and products. My responsibilities include: fundraising; strategic embedding of the project in overall NGO strategies; reporting to funders; quality control; event organisation; and content management for the project website.

projects.title: OV-held 2011
projects.description:
Mijn OV-held (My Public Transport Hero) is a campaign to have passengers in public transport nominate their favourite bus/tram/train driver or conductor. Either because they know them well, or because they simply do their job very well. 
Outcome of the campaign was the election of 'Mr & Mrs Bus' and 'Mr & Mrs Train'.

courses.name: Ecological systems theory and aquatic ecosystems

profile_positions.description:
The province of Groningen is a key player in organising and maintaining the options people and
organisations have for travelling, e.g. by tendering public transport. Working closely with many
organisations and the regional minister for transport, I headed and developed the new strategic policy
programme ‘Programma Mobiliteit Provincie Groningen’. It is groundbreaking in linking transport
policy measures to wider societal issues such as poverty, equality, sustainability, economic
development, etc. Other responsibilities include managing relations with the Dutch national ministry
of Infrastructure and water management.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Smart & Green Transport Strategy

profile_positions.description:
Train2EU is a non-profit aiming to make international rail travel easier for passengers. Europe is a great continent to travel by train, but the potential of the international train connections we have is under utilised. Issues of interoperability and governance make train travel in the EU unnecessarily complicated and expensive. (Potential) passengers instead choose to fly within Europe. Aviation is a major contributor to CO2-emissions and climate change, whilst train travel is the most energy-efficient way to travel. 
I am a founding member of Train2EU, now vice-president on strategic issues.
profile_positions.title: Vice-President of Strategy
Coördinating Advisor of Regional Mobility Programmes

profile_positions.description:
The twelve provincies of the Netherlands are key authorities when it comes to making transport more sustainable. Through the IPO office in The Hague, the twelve provincies collaborate not only as public transport authorities, but also as co-ordinating interlocutors between European and national sustainable transport policy on one side, and practical on-the-ground measures on the local level. 

My responsibilities as senior advisor at IPO include:
- negotiating on behalf of the twelve provinces in the upcoming national Climate and Energy Agreement
- strategic alignment of the provinces vis-a-vis national and local authorities
- preparing meetings for and with provincial ministers
- developing and executing a joint programme on sustainable transport
- building and maintaining a network of (sustainable) transport experts within the twelve provincies
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Sustainable Transport Strategy

profile_positions.description:
The T&E board is involved in the daily operation of the T&E office in Brussels, and closely involved in the strategy T&E chooses to make Europe the most transport efficient economy in the world.
As vice president, my task is to help keep the secretariat run smoothly.
profile_positions.title: Vice President

profile_positions.description: The T&E board is involved in the daily operation of the T&E office in Brussels, and closely involved in the strategy T&E chooses to make Europe the most transport efficient economy in the world.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board

profile_positions.description:
Natuur & Milieu is a Dutch environmental NGO focussed on influencing policies to better the world. I worked in the transport and spatial planning team. My responsibilities and key projects included: 
* Maintaining the international network of European sister organisations and umbrella organisations of Natuur & Milieu
* Influencing European sustainable transport policy making processes, notably the creation and reviews of the EU CO2 limits for passenger cars and light duty vehicles. This included lobbying MEPs of all nationalities, talks with the Dutch permanent representation to the EU, talks with EU Commission officials up to the Commissioners of climate and transport. 
* Influencing Dutch sustainable transport policy making processes. I spoke to government officials in The Hague as well as Brussels on a daily basis. 
* I envisioned and initiated The Cleaner Car Contracts coalition of European car leasing companies, educating them on best practices in sustainable fleet management and focussing their messaging to influence Dutch national as well as European CO2-policies. The coalition also actively stimulated deployment of sustainable vehicles and technologies with their clients. 
* Community development, mainly with commercial and NGO partners
* Critical review of government infrastructure plans
* Participating in the development of “c,mm,n: your mobility, our c,mm,n future”, which was a vision on a sustainable transport system based on networked, self-driving and zero-emission cars in 2006. In 2007 and 2009, I helped create exhibitions on sustainable transport and c,mm,n at the Dutch national car show AutoRAI. 
* Lobbying on biomass as transport fuels, aiming to prevent overstimulation as a fuel feedstocks and other biomass sources that would harm natural systems or food security around the world
* creating online content to explain how vehicle noise testing works
* Integration of transport infrastructure and spatial planning
profile_positions.title: Project leader Transport and Energy

profile_positions.description:
During the European election campaign of 2014, I helped Dutch political party GroenLinks (GreenLeft) with expertise on green issues: environment, energy, agriculture, animal welfare, etc. 
Responsibilities included: 
- preparing candidates for election debates with briefings on green topics
- preparing volunteers for answering questions from the public on green issues
- (co-)authoring press releases and opinion articles
- authoring the Green Energy Union action plan
- supplying the air quality election campaign 'SOSlucht' with expert information on air quality issues
- co-ordinating with the Greens in the European Parliament 
- assisting the Green fraction in national parliament 
- answering questions on green issues from potential voters
profile_positions.title: Policy Adviser Energy, Environment and Agriculture

profile_positions.description:
Transition Towns Heuvelrug aims to initiate and support local Transition Town initiatives in the area of Utrechtse Heuvelrug, the Netherlands. 
I initiated TT Heuvelrug in 2010 and chaired it for almost two years.
profile_positions.title: Chair

profile_positions.description: I developed and implemented the 'EU Vote Watch', an internet publication of how environmentally (un)friendly Member of European Parliament (MEPs) actually voted on critical environmental dossiers.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
During my studies, I was a member of the board for Aktief Slip, the society of students in environmental sciences at Wageningen University, Wageningen, the Netherlands. 
My position was Commissioner on internal affairs, making me responsible for all committees and working groups within the society.
profile_positions.title: Commissioner on internal affairs

volunteer_experiences.description:
Transition Towns is a globally spread grassroots movement aiming to make local communities more resilient against the consequences of Peak Oil and climate change, at the same reducing their contribution to these global challenges.
I initiated the TT initiative in the town of Den Dolder, the Netherlands.

'Groen Café' was an initiative some green minded Dutch youngsters following Ecotopia 2004 in the Netherlands. I was one of the initiators. In the following three years, we regularly organised informal meetings, usually in a bar, to discuss environmentally related discussion evenings. Some topics were: humanitarian effects of global warming with the Red Cross; how green is the European Parliament with the ministry of Environment and Dutch MEPs.
